This is a pretty chill place to hit for lunch on the weekends, they were playing some really good alt music too. Exactly what I was in the mood for after a crazy weekend.

Service was good, but it wasnt very busy so thats expected. Everyone was very friendly too.

I had a shrimp burrito. It was great - nice and spicy, good portions. I havent had too many shrimp burritos so this was a pretty sweet find!! My friend and I also had some sangria (was the special that day). It wasnt the best I have ever had, but it was still pretty good.
Margaritas were crystal clear! Margaritas had subtle notes of sprite or seltzer? Intriguing!

Cactus cantina provides a very welcoming atmosphere. The staff is friendly and actively engages u from when u enter.

Drink selection is quality and the bartender Kyle will make anything u ask.

Food is affordable and is filling.

Heartily recommend this place.

Saturday night... city festivities kept us from downtown. We started with the Host telling my friend who first arrived he couldn't hold the table.  Server was awesome (Very Friendly and accommodating) ... food was meh (Over cooked wings; tacoquitos felt like they were missing something; chili - umm yeah not my thing but my friend said it was okay; best was the chips, guac was okay, salsa out of jar but okay). The kicker... I was served a Moscow Mule in a ceramic mug! Please remove from your menu if your not going to do it right.

a nice little spot on main st in manayunk with daily specials that wont break the bank. plenty of food specials and drink specials. Wing night 35 cent wings. Love there chicken quesadillas. nice seating outside for when the weather is nice. Overall a good spot

Checked in here, had one sip of my margarita and couldn't wait to check out. The servers were very polite and nice. Everything else was quite miserable. The margaritas tasted and nearly looked liked flat sprite. They were extremely syrupy sweet with the this slightly flat carbonation. Tacos were a hit or miss. Some were cold but one friend of 5 said his pulled pork was decent. Overall I'd recommend walking right by this place.
Cactus is awesome!!! Tony is the best. Corona towers, awesome food. No salad bar tho. Otherwise, excellent!!!!
This is one of my favorite spots in manayunk. Great specials all week, bar tenders are friendly, and $4 drafts + $6 quesadillas on Thursdays. Ask for Andres. Very accommodating for specialty drinks.
This place is awesome! Was here for cinco de mayo, even though it was crowded the food was amazing!!! The drinks were on point too! I will definitely come back on a regular day.

Went back and had the most watered down drinks ever. Manager was shouting at his servers in front of customers and to make it cringier he actually fought with two customers behind us who disputed something on their bill. Servers were pleasant though looked miserable. The ''manager" was rude and shook his head at other customers a lot and referred to his staff as "mother f**kers". Anyway, save yourself the hassle and don't visit this place. It sucks.

My coworkers & I have had some FUN & INEXPENSIVE happy hours here.  

The good:  Cactus seated our party of 10 in no time @ 5:30 for happy hour, we took advantage of their $10 margarita pitchers Monday night happy hour special, we were promptly served free chips & salsa, the service was great (there when we needed them, not overbearing).  The total bill came to $25.  

The not-so-good:  Since our group was so large we sat in the dimly lit back of the restaurant - half booth half chairs.  The air duct over the booth seating was dripping with condensation and half our party got a little wet (it was a small price to pay for being in a nicely air-conditioned space on a hot July evening).  The chips were a little stale, but I'm being bratty by complaining because they were FREE.  The margaritas were heavy on the mix, light on tequila but for $10 a pitcher I'm compelled to lower my standards.

On a separate occasion I came with a smaller group & sat outside for their happy hour.  Again, specials were great & the staff were very accomodating.  The only problem I had was with the tiny tables - our group of 3 ordered the nachos & portabello quesadillas to split.  Our 4-top table couldn't accomodate 3 small appetizer plates & 2 entree sized plates & it was a little tricky trying to find a spot to rest your drink.

Expect what you pay for - and you'll have an enjoyable time @ HH with Cactus.

First time I went to Cactus was on their opening night. No remarkable memory of that evening but I'm all for not judging a restaurant on their opening night.
I was looking for a decent and inexpensive place to grab lunch with a friend, and Manayunk area is not easy: you either have sandwich shops or fine dining... Cactus turned out to be a good balance. The food was almost better than I expected and the service very nice... I ordered the Fajita salad (fresh and tasty) and my friend had the pulled pork which he was raving about. Don't expect anything but a decent casual Tex-Mex, and you won't be disappointed.

If you want to go to a fun casual place with great margaritas and a terrific beer selection... this is a great place to go...  The people are friendly,, the service is friendly.. the food is consistent and if you take advantage of the promos.. you can eat and drink very inexpensively..  The salsa is addictive... the burritos and quesadillas are top... and to make things even better you can watch all the games on the variety of TVS..
First time eating here and had an amazing time. Tony and Colleen took great care of us, and we're looking forward to coming back and having some more of the famous pulled pork!

My girlfriend and I dropped in on a Wednesday, just after the place had opened. This is really the only time I can enjoy Manayunk, when the raunchy bar crowds are still stuck at work, and on this night it made for a great early dinner. We hit up their 25-cent wing special for starters, and shared their pork enchiladas and "loaded burrito," the latter of which was smothered in a generous helping of rich, creamy cheese sauce. It was some excellent Tex-Mex, loaded with chili flavor but never too hot for comfort. My Malbec was tasty and my lady's margaritas were very fruity, just to her taste. Not much to complain about, but I can picture the late night scene looking quite a bit different from what I've just described.

Really impressed!

We went to this place because we were craving some Mexican food. We didn't know what to expect as we read different mixed reviews about this place, but we were glad we stopped by and gave this place a chance. 
My wife ordered the longhorn meal and we shared.
I ordered the pulled pork with black bean salsa and we both shared it as well.
We also had the stuffed jalapeno with three different kinds of cheese for an appetizer and were impressed. 
We were stuffed and we actually had some left overs. 
I would definitely recommend you checking this place out if you are looking for a great place to eat for a reasonable price.

Bartender was the only service and he got overwhelmed when more people came.  My burrito was hard and crunchy. Probably frozen and defrosted in oven.  Absolutely no moisture. Maybe the worse burrito I had in a while.

Ugh. The only good thing about this place are the wings. Service is always terrible, margaritas are water + sour mix, food is meh, and did I mention how poor service is?

Go for wings on wing night. Go elsewhere for anything else.

I went for wino Wednesday last night and possibly had one of the best nights in a long time. cactus has a great atmosphere; delicious food and drinks, and wonderful staff. My friends and i went with no expectations and had a terrific time. It is also very affordable. If you are a tequila fan this is the place to be, i think they have every tequila under the sun. I would recommend cactus to anyone looking for an enjoyable night!!

Always have amazing service. Good food, a little pricey but totally worth it. The quality of their margaritas and quesadillas is fantastic. Save room for dessert- highly recommend the chocolate quesadilla. The atmosphere is awesome with not too rowdy of a crowd during the week and on Friday and Saturday nights. Definitely worth a visit

I managed to get to Cactus a few months ago and forgot to review. 

I'm not quite sure if Cactus is a bar trying to serve food, or a restaurant looking to push drinks. Either way, there is something about this place that just seems a bit off. 

The guac was promoted as being very good, but it was ordinary at best. Our entrees were not horrible, but nothing to write home about either. Even the drinks were ok, but I've definitely had better margaritas. 

The space was kinda cramped, but it was nicely decorated. The next time I'm going through Manyunk, I would definitely give it another shot, but its not an establishment that I would to consider to be a "destination."

Visited on a Saturday (before St Patrick's day) at 4pm as part of a bar crawl and there were only 2 servers, and the entire up stairs was closed. I had a margarita and it was really good and the staff was very friendly, they were just extremely under staffed. We were going to order food, but there was nobody to take our order and we felt like we'd have to wait too long. We left and went elsewhere to get more drinks and food. Don't know if their food is good; we never got to try it. I'm probably try somewhere else if I'm in the area again.
I come here often. Its a cool, fun and diverse environment. Tony and staff always make sure that everyone including myself are taken care of. Thanks Cactus!

No-thrills Mexican fare, but their fatal flaw is their stinginess.  

When ordering a margarita pitcher, it is expected that one would receive a wholesale discount from the individual drinks.  The individual margarita is $8 (too high to justify in itself), however a pitcher costs $32 and it doesn't even fill four glasses!  I have never been to an establishment where you pay a premium for buying in bulk.

We also ordered the nachos with guacamole and chicken (each of which commanded an additional $2 charge).  When the nachos arrived, it was obvious they didn't include additional chips for the added portions and the chip to topping ratio was amiss.  Needless to say, we tried to make the best of it but were left with no chips and unconsumed food.  We asked for additional chips but were told we couldn't have any.  If the restaurant isn't named Taco Bell, an additional 50 cents worth of tortilla chips should be a given.

Manayunk is full of great restaurants eager to please their patrons.  Cactus is not one of them.
Best pulled pork sandwich I've ever had!!!! Great prices too. The salsa was also very good. The waiter was very polite. Definitely try it.

Absolutely, positively, THE BEST chili I have EVER had!  Get the "Desert Heat". It ain't hot at all but it is AMAZING!  Get the cheese and sour cream on top, too. 

Seriously, I've been to half the states in America and half way around the world. THE BEST chili EVER! (Damn good Margaritas also)

The servers are really cool, too!

Ive been coming here for years now, always great staff, quick service and awesome food. Today I came in to get take out and the girl working the bar gave me attitude as soon as I walked in and was just plain rude. (Small framed girl with long blondish/strawberry blond hair). The entire 15 minutes I waited for my food she never offered me a drink. She needs a major attitude check; anyone in customer service should be pleasant and she was the complete opposite. Giving a 5 because I love this place and dont want to give the restaurant itself a bad rating but like previously stated, she needs an attitude check.

It's rare, but every now and again I will fill an appeal to the Official Council of Yelp Ratings to request that a star be added to a business' review. It's an elaborate process that involves a meeting of dignitaries from around the globe, but sometimes, as in this case, it's worth it. Well, the council has spoken, and I hereby add a star to my previous review of Cactus.

We stopped in to watch a midday Phillies game today, and had a great experience, thanks mostly to the very friendly demeanor of Mike the bartender. He recommended that we order some of the wings, which were .25 on Wednesdays, and different than your usual buffalo wings. They are a smokey mix of a chipotle bbq sauce and wing sauce. I was really glad he did, as they were awesome, fried to crispy perfection. 

They also have a pretty impressive beer selection. To go with the TexMex theme, they have a wide array of Mexican beers, but they also have the full PBC line in bottles, and several other creative selections. 

I would definitely recommend stopping by for lunch one day.

How impressive is the food at Cactus?  Considering nearly everything went wrong with my recent dining experience, pretty damn impressive.

We arrived on Saturday for a quick bite.  It was busy, so we were sat all the way in the back, by the bathrooms.  It took nearly 10 minutes to get water to our table and another 5 for chips and salsa.  Once we ordered (another ~ 10 minutes), we didn't see our waiter again until the bill.  Apps took quite a bit of time to get to the table, my margarita sat at the bar for a good 10 minutes before it reached the table, our dinners came out while we were still eating the app, and they gave me pork instead of beef in my enchiladas.

So how good is the food?  Well, there salsa might be the best I've ever had.  I love their margaritas, and both the pork and beef enchiladas were solid - yes, they corrected my order without an issue.  Honestly, the food is 4 or 5 star worthy, so I am going back on a calmer night to let them earn those extra stars!
I had a great experience. The food was good and the bartender was great. If your looking for a good Mexican bar in manayunk this is the place.

Good food and even better margaritas! Cactus is the perfect place to grab a casual bite with friends, and has specials during the week like half priced margarita pitchers on Monday's and trivia nights on Thursday's. When the weather is nice, you can sit outside but it's a little tight. Overall it's a great place.

Be sure to bring your ID on a Friday or Saturday night if you roll up after dinner. Because this is a popular college destination, you can usually count on a bouncer barring access on those nights. That being said, Cactus is really popular and is usually packed to the gills with that crowd on the weekends.

Once you're inside, the decor is fairly spartan, although the walls are bright shade of golden yellow, which evokes the southwestern/Mexican theme. My friends and I got a pitcher of sangria, which was a little watered down to my taste, but it was really cheap on special, so that was a win. 

I also ordered the beef enchiladas, which were all right--they came absolutely covered in cheese, which overpowered the simple beef flavors within (I say simple because it was just mildly spiced ground beef inside). Rice and black beans (not refried) come on the side. This kind of food is great for a late Saturday evening snack (or really late dinner) if you're out on the town.

The salsa for the chips basket is indeed delicious and has just the right burn. I gobbled that up fairly quickly. Just to clear up the question of the "free" chips and salsa: first round is always on the house. If you ask for another basket, you pay $4 for the pleasure of getting unlimited refills of the basket for the rest of the night.

The service was really good, though, and the waiter didn't even bat an eye at the wildly inappropriate conversation that was going on under his nose, so kudos to him!

My first experience with Cactus was on a Memorial Day, which probably gave me a far more favorable impression of the place than I normally would have gotten.  Service was lightning fast (of course, the place was dead!), bar staff was pleasant...plus, Cactus does $10 margarita pitchers on Mondays.  This alone kept a friend coming back on a number of Mondays thereafter!

Actually having meals before 8 PM at Cactus, however, is an entirely different world.  I've now been there for brunch, weekday dinner, and weekend dinner, and have seen one HUGE theme -- almost entirely absent wait staff.  This would be a little more forgivable if the place had more than 10 tables!  When celebrating a friend's birthday, 25 minutes went by between being able to order drinks and food.  Outrageous!  However, I do have to hand it to their incredibly friendly owner, Tony; when he found out what happened, he offered us two rounds of shots on the house.  As for the food, not bad...I'd definitely recommend them for Sunday bunch (especially if you find other Main Street spots too crowded).

If you're looking for anything resembling real Mexican food, don't go here. The menu looked promising but the food just isn't good. This is strip mall Tex Mex food. With the prices they charge here, you're better off going to Qdoba or Chipotle--your food will at least contain other ingredients besides excessive cheese and meat.

Today at the Manayunk Art Festival, my wife
and I decided we were going to take a break and have some adult beverages and food at the Cactus. We saw an open table outside and we were in for a great experience. We ordered the Cactus Nachos and some Margaritas. The Nachos were wonderful. You can add whatever meat you want, we added steak and with the corn cheese sauce. This corn cheese sauce has a nice sweet start and if you add jalapeño's you have a nice 'zing' at the end.  The salsa and chips were amazing. The Salsa has a very sweet taste up front followed by a nice 'kick' of jalapeños at the end. The chips were fresh and delicious. Loved the Margaritas and we would definitely return to this restaurant. Even though it was a very busy day at the Festival the service was wonderful! 

I was in old town San Diego in California and the Nachos at the Cactus were different and more flavorful than anything we had there.

I'm a fan... I find myself getting the quesadilla almost every time I'm here, but the tacos are good as well. The free chips and salsa are always a plus, and I like their salsa even though it's a little different. The guac is good, but a little costly for what you get.

Had the margaritas before, and they are good, but really expensive (unless you go on Monday for their special). Fortunately, they have a pretty decent beer selection for other days of the week.

Overall, a good option for when you want a casual mexican-ish meal.

I LOVE this place. The salsa is so good and food is always the best. The atmosphere is so welcoming and the owner is great! Definitely the best Mexican food in Manayunk. Try the sangria and margaritas!!
I love the margaritas. Great food and drink specials daily.  My only suggestion would be that the cooks need to be more consistent.
Was okay drinks was a lilttle watered down but love the fish taco

This place was not great. The margaritas tasted like yellow gatorade and only maybe had tequila in them. The guacamole had no flavor. We tried to leave as quickly as possible. Also, no gluten free options, so that was kind of disappointing. I would not recommend anyone go here.

Loveeee thisss placeee ! Tony the manager and Eric the bartender were amazing!  Great customer service and definitely made me and my friend to feel welcomed !  Great tacos great margs ! If you're in Manayunk definitely come here !!!!!!

I saw someone post that the chips were stale and I just had to say that all of their chips are the freshly served kind... not like a Tostitos brand. ...and that salsa! It is smokey and delicious and damn near dangerous to consume! I have often found myself at the bottom of many a chips and salsa basket wanting more and more! The chips are a bit salty BUT when paired with the smokey salsa it works. Plus, it will give you a chance to sample some of their really well thought out beer selections. Good deal I think! (The Tequila flights will get you in trouble... do it)

The real shining stars of this fine Mexican establishment , besides Tony the owner, is: 1) The pulled pork. Anything with the pulled pork is sure to make your mouth happy. Nachos, Tacos, Enchiladas... have it in everything. EVERYTHING. Put some of their mashed sweet carrots in the mix and you will NOT be disappointed. 2) The margaritas. On the rocks and any flavor is awesome. Check their listing because they have drinks specials where the Margaritas can keep flowing at a fabulous price!

Give it a try... and then slather yourself in pulled pork. Good times will follow!
Had a great time staff and owner was wonderful and very welcoming the food was great nice atmosphere.  I will defiantly hang out at the cactus in the future

I've was here for the first time last night but I assure you it won't be the last. The Wednesday wings for 35¢ is an excellent bargain as the wings are pretty big and definitely cooked and seasoned well. The margaritas are good and contain a good amount of alcohol, even if they are slightly pricey (1 or 1.50 more than I would have preferred). The complimentary tortilla chips are good and a nice touch. Because it was a Wednesday service was impeccable. But it's easier on days like Wednesday especially when late. They have a good atmosphere and the optional outside seating is nice. Tony who I think is the owner personally took care of my friend and I. He was very personable and friendly. His service was good and he informed us of specials and he made a few recommendations.

I would need to go again and get a dinner or maybe be on a more crowded night.

But first impressions are important. And Cactus left a good impression on me as did Tony. Good enough to come back.

Amazing special on mondays, $10 pitchers of margaritas! My roommates and I each get our own pitcher, its such a good deal! The waiter and waitresses I have had here have all been so sweet and fun! Love it here!
Great food! Good service great location kinda busy at night but overall good environment. Good drinks & great food specials! $.35 wings on Wednesday

Went to Cactus yesterday first time and sat down at bar.  Bartender was super nice and very quick when making drinks for multiple people.  Her name was Molly. She suggested some popular cocktails and told us about the brunch special.  Also the waitress Claire was a doll always happy and smiling all over the place and always checking in on us making sure our water was filled and our beer glasses didn't run dry.  This is a place to get to on a lazy sunday to chill and have a sunday fun day!

Stopped in for a drink. The female bartender was extremely rude and acted as if i was bothering her when i tried to order a drink. I just had to hear her talk down about her management team to other guests for being cheap not buying fresh ingredients for drinks. Bad experience will not go back. Wish i could have experienced the food.

Besides the most AMAZING waitstaff known to mankind, this restaurant also boasts $10 pitchers of DELICIOUS margaritas! ! & they don't skimp on the good stuff in these Margarita pitchers! Plus lots of other drink specials & some pretty banging food! 

Alex is an ADORABLE and hilarious waiter with lots of interesting small talk to offer & samantha (I may have her name wrong) is possibly more adorable, advertised her restaurant to me when she wasn't at work (which shows me the owners keep a great work environment), & spoke to the menu knowledgeabley. 

I've been here a few times and everyone seems happy to be working.  The place is one of the cleaner establishments in mnyk. 

& outdoor seating where they brought my dog water!

I really like this place. It's one of the first bars we went to when we moved here and we've been back a few times since. The fish tacos are REALLY good and they have a pretty good beer selection. The Star Island is my favorite. We haven't been for a happy hour yet, but it looks like they have pretty good deals (they change daily). We will definitely go back again.

Tony is an amazing banter-tender!! I would do 5 stars but it probably won't let me! He taught me  about so many drinks and beers ! Please try Grapejuice and 007!!!! He's very experienced and I'm so pleased. So glad this bar has someone that knows their stuff ! I wish the best for this bar and for this bartender!

Busy St Paddies Saturday but they were on top of their game at peak hours, rhen we came back Sunday for our friends birthday, and was just as good.

Appreciate the good times, and those nachos were dope. Plus the tequila aged in smoked whoskey barrels...

One of my favorite places to go! Their margarita pitchers are well priced & well poured & their wings are AMAZING! The best wing sauce ever! The staff is always great & the owner, Tony is awesome! Always personable to the customers & the staff. I never leave disappointed!

This place has a chill atmosphere, very friendly and rarely densely crowded. There's great (cheap) deals from day to day... but taco tuesdays are a must for 2 dollars and pictures of margaritas. They boast a huge selection of the various types of tequila if that is your thing. Best item on the menu is the pulled pork! On anythinggg it's slow cooked for like two days and is perfection. Kyle is a dope bartender and if u're lucky to land Aisha as your waiter u're in for a good time. Order the "Alien Brain Hemmorage" shot... out of this world forreal

Another great spot on the brunch list.  Hubby and I went on Saturday, early afternoon.  Bloody marys were $3 and really good.  We both got omelets.  They were good.  Reasonably priced.  Service was good.  Very casual, relaxed environment - no bells and whistles...just a good local spot.  We definitely will return for some Mexican treats.
best mexican food I've had in a while. Their special homemade salsa is incredible. nice low key spot with a good atmosphere and excellent service.

Cactus is our local favorite for authentic Mexican food. The food is a reasonable price and is always excellent. My personal favorite is the fajitas which they even have a size option, for one or for two... we like to get fajitas for two and split appetizers because they always have a good happy hour menu. Atmosphere is great, food is excellent and the drinks are also great. Not to mention the staff, they are awesome and extremely attentive. Highly recommend!!!

After paying a few more visits to this "cantina" and having a better experience each time I am now ready to reward Cactus  with another star! 

The one major gripe I had with Cactus in my previous review was that it seemed understaffed and the bartender doubled as the waiter and then again as the hostess.  They must have read my review because now they have plenty of servers and a bartender who has plenty of time to make you a drink and have a friendly chat!

The seem to also have expanded their brew menu by adding some Philadelphia Brewing Company(!!!!) and other microbrews.  Also, try the wings.....more tangy than spicy and have an amazing crisp to them....on Wednesday's the special is .25/wing.

I am so happy to see that this place is making improvements and bettering themselves.....Cactus is now is my top 5 bars along Main Street!

We ordered sangria, we did not enjoy :-(
Also the tortilla chips were uber salty and stale. No thanks!
The $10.00 pitcher of margaritas are half the size they were last year  so it's no longer worth the trip.  Food has never been consistent.

Went here for the first time last weekend. Didn't have high expectations but boy did they blow me away! First off the staff is AMAZING. They were more than accommodating and really nice and friendly. The manager is really nice as well. The chips and salsa were so fresh and delicious! I am actually craving them right now. We went there thinking it would just be typical bar food with a tex mex flare but boy were we wrong. The atmosphere was great as well as the food. Did I mention the chips and salsa??? Delish! I also have a food allergy so I can be a bit of a pain when ordering and the staff was more than happy and actually went out of their way to accommodate my very specific food needs. Great place will definetly return!

I had a birthday dinner here years ago but this was my first time back as someone who was over 21. It was during happy hour and I got their regular margarita was was wonderful because it has just the right ratio of everything and wasn't too much on the tequila. I ordered chicken tacos which came with a side of rice and it was just the right portion size and tasted good. My big thing about the place is that me and my friend were sitting in the back and there were a lot of gnats I think they were? Or fruit filies? It kind of ruined the dinner experience a little bit. But I would definitely come back.

Yay I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.  Went there for a girls night out and immediately ordered pitchers of sangria & margaritas oh yummy! Drinks were excellent, service was pretty good.  Two bathrooms for the whole restaurant... not good =0(  We ordered the cactus nachos which were up there in my top 5 best nachos of the world!! Excellent nachos!! I was stupid and ordered something else thinking it would be just as good.  Nope.  My recommendation is nachos & sangria and you will be set.  Also the dj kept changing the songs we liked.  Like we would hear it for 30 seconds and then he would skip..poop =( 
I would totally go back for the nachos & sangria!!
St. Pattys brunch was delicious. Tony was extremely helpful and very friendly. Will definitely be coming back. Cactus nachos are top notch.
Not a bad place! Things seem a little pricey but they have the best enchiladas I've ever had! Not to say I'm an enchilada connoisseur but I love them! Highly recommend it :) a manayunk fave!

As soon as I got there I was immediately seated and greeted. The manager Tony was awesome! He made sure I was well taken care of the entire night. Wait staff was very attentive to all my needs and the food and drinks were amazing! My food came out quickly. I would definitely go back again. Great time for either a girls night out or a nice date.
Quality food, great margs and good selection of beers on tap. Great specials and staff is always attentive! Tony genuinely takes care of customers and every visit is a blast!

Hospitality is second to none! Went here on a whim to try something new and left very happy with our decision to go to Cactus. Hospitality is second to none. We got a pitcher of the house margs and were pleasantly surprised with how much flavor it had. Meals were large and well-priced, but don't expect anything mind-blowing... a classic American/Mexican menu. If you're looking for solid happy hour deals in the heart of Manayunk, this is the place. We'll be back!

HORRIBLE FOOD!! I don't tend to leave bad reviews but this place's food was horrible! Also, costumer service was pretty bad. To start, the hostess was very condescending then went ahead and plaed my husband and I in a very small and on the way table. The appetizer was good but then my food came out and it was cold. The meat in my tacos tasted sour and disgusting. The rice, that was included in the dish, was dry. And the worst thing is that the food was very bland. Now, we all know Mexican food is supposed to be very flavorful! So this place was a total fail!  
NEVER EVER coming back!

I'd like to leave 0 stars. The past two times I have visited this establishment (and I shouldn't have gone the second time) the service was AWFUL. 

We went one night to have a drink, they sat us at a table in the back of the restaurant and then looked at us about 8 times and never came back to serve us, take our order, even say hello. We sat here for 20 minutes with no service and got up and left. 

I went back this past Friday to meet friends. Again when trying to get a drink, we were unable to be served, even though Tony the owner was looking right at us and saying he'd make drinks and never did. When a girl at the bar (who seemed friendly with him) asked him to get us drinks, his reply was 'f*ck those girls' and he walked away. 

Obviously we left and I have learned my lesson and will never return.

Their brunch is more satisfying than their dinner. Then again, I've never had a bad breakfast burrito. Their nachos are particularly underwhelming for a Mexican joint. The tequila selection here is impressive but whatever else they're adding to their margaritas is not. If you can't make the pilgrimage westward to Plaza Azteca, Cactus will probably do the trick (service is attentive and friendly).
Cactus. Mike Molly and Kati are the best. Eat more chicken.  Cant win them all. And can't forget about Claire.

love cactus!! great food and great drinks! i come here often with friends for drinks and apps. Their salsa is made fresh daily
and delicious!!! staff is always friendly. Had to write this review to highlight
our server Ryan tonight. He was funny, personable, and attentive!
Fantastic restaurant the most courteous  and friendly staff and in my opinion the most culturally eclectic bar in Manayunk. Very diverse and equally accepted crowd

I know this is a Mexican restaurant but the only reason to go here is for wings.  some of the better wings in Manayunk (25 cent wings on Wednesdays) and chips and salsa are top notch.  My girlfriend and I routinely go in on Wednesdays, each eat a dozen wings, have some chips and salsa, get drinks, and leave without spending 10 dollars.

So me and my friend are here as I type this and it took them almost an hour to make our food.. after an hour my friends food came and it literally looked like dog food the waiter said "yea I knew you would say something he messed the burrito up (the cook) " so he takes the food back and never bring my food out. The girl with the curly hair (Aisha)came over brought our check and we didn't even eat lol we told her our concerns and she went to "check on our food". When they bring her food out is when they bring mines .. this food is suppose to be just made and it was cold and not worth it at all I'm still hungry  and  the drinks taste like straight up soda . NEVER AGAIN last but not least it was not crowded at all so idk what was the hold up :(
I posted this four years ago and a friend just notified me some clown at this restaurant responded this post was fake.  It is 100% genuine so nice attempt manager guy.

Well, what can I say. I almost gave it a one star, but remembered that when I checked in on yelp, we received a free appetizer! What's with places not knowing about that. 2x's I have checked in and had that promotion come up and both times... Unaware or it. Interesting. The appetizer, chicken spring roll, was the best part of the meal. Both entrees left a lot to be desired. Mine, the chicken quesadilla, would have been good, but all of the chicken was severely dehydrated?? The other entree, shrimp fajitas, lacked appeal. The tail was on the shrimp? I am thinking that this is a hit or mIss spot that in the future I will be missing. 2 stars out of 5, but the good was 1 star.

Best mexican food in manayunk. My girlfriend and I come here all the time, and never had a bad experience. Chicken tacos are good price and taste great, and the burritos are banging. A must go on quizzo night. Brandon was a huge help

Great service and drink specials. Free chips and salsa definitely don't hurt. Plenty of outdoor seating as well to enjoy.  I had the chipotle chicken sandwich wrap and was impressed. This place checks all the boxes for mid level Tex-mex bar food.

I went here for the 1st time last week - sad to say it was horrible. Not sure how you can mess up a margarita, let alone a taco but both were disgusting. The bartender was seemed so uninterested & played on his phone the whole time. Will NOT be back.
Great food, wonderful service and cheap margaritas!! Had a great evening out with some friends and will definitely be back.
Waitress brought us a round of drinks and appetizer, then completely disappeared. Wasn't busy. Had to get the bartender to cash us out.

Cactus is a the perfect place for a low key night out with friends. Great prices for Main St, especially during the week with all of their specials. The food is super filling and the service is nice and efficient. You can tell how they all work as a team. Also I've been here a few times and the servers and bartenders really make an effort to remember your name. Very friendly! Great beer selection too!

Sadly , I received some clarification today, the cactus nachos, which are one of the most
Popular food items on the menu due to the most amazing corn salsa, has been discontinued from the menu. I am devastating as it was hands down the best nachos I've ever had. I'm writing this review in hopes that we can bring them back to the menu. I know this sounds dramatic haha but everyone I've brought to have these nachos rave about them! Please consider bringing them back !
They're wings were good. Went during the week and it happened to be wing day so my food was dirt cheap. Lol. Lucky me. I didn't try much else. Not much heathy choices. Not bad for the price.
I love their spicy chicken caesar salad, chicken enchilada and their chili. #solidcourses

Defining moments are infrequent but oh so important. And that's what I felt the first time I dined at Cactus. Want the experience of a free trip down to Tempe, AZ right here in PA? 

Head down to Cactus on main. The ambiance is on point, the drinks (both beer and cocktails) are unreal, and the service (especially Tony) is LEGEN - wait for it - DARY. Not to mention the burritos, just delish.

It's always a good time at Cactus, so come on down for some GTs (good times and gin and tonics)

I am giving this 4 stars  because the service was wonderful. Everyone we saw walking around helped us out. The staff was working together filling waters, grabbing our plates, getting new beers...it was very good! 
25 cent wings were awesome but I will mostly be back because of the service! Everyone was so friendly!

Ew! This place is actually gross. Ate here over the weekend with family and the decor was dated, service was slow, and food was really bad. I ordered a veggie burrito and realized on about the second bite that there was a bunch of pork hidden inside. The waitstaff did replace it, but eating meat for the first time in over 5 years led to a really upset stomach and ruined the rest of my night -- definitely not worth it for such bad food! There were 4 others in my party who all ordered different things (five alarm burrito, chicken quesadillas, fajita salad, and a chipotle chicken sandwich), and nobody was even slightly impressed. Perfect excuse to have a second dinner elsewhere after coming here.

The prices are decent and chips and salsa are good. That is about it. We were seated right next to the waitstaff station and it was loud, we saw waitresses drinking Gatorades and eating chips, and several things were dropped right in front of us. I totally understand that waitstaff need a place to eat, hydrate, and maybe take a quick break, but right in front of a table of guests is not the right place.

It's about time I wrote a review about Cactus.  I'm the only Canadian that frequents this place.  It's also pretty obvious people know this because it's always empty when I come in.... they must see the snow I drag in behind me and the way I'm always talking about Tim Horton's and hockey.

I usually come in late afternoon on Tuesdays and get horrendous service from the bartender Stefan, a small man from Detroit 1-8-7 who has the personality of a 10th grade English teacher that's sleeping.

No, seriously, I'm pretty much a regular and am always there watching college football or baseball.  $3.50 Philadelphia Brewing Co. beers and stellar company behind the bar!!!!

Bautista!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Came here to get started on happy hour and we had the mixed berry marg, which was their Monday special for $5. It tasted like a huggy or some grape concord drink. We tried looking at their website for specials prior to sitting down but it was not updated. Allegedly they don't have the password to update it? Yeah. But, this place is good if you want a quick fix or a snack but I wouldn't stay for long (they also don't have the upstairs open).
Zero Stars! Bartender was so racist, black people are not welcomed should be their slogan!
I love this place! It's a weekly for me! Great deals on everything every night of the week! Great margaritas food is good staff is great! Great neighborhood place to hangout!

Had a great time tonight Tony hooked me up and he knows his sports. The wings were great and there was servers everywhere so I didn't have to wait on drinks. It was a great time it's a every night spot.

Worst service ever.  After sitting here at a table for 20 minutes, I'm writing this review before I get up and leave.

We saw the GM/owner standing in the doorway, asked if they had a bar, and when he said yes, asked of we could have a table outside and sat down.  With 8 tables outside, there are 3 girls at one table, already with drinks, the other tables all set but empty.  We sat, he went inside (I thought to get menus for us)

After about 5 minutes, my girlfriend got up to go inside and had to ask the same guy for menus.  No excuse for not knowing we were sitting there now!

After 5 more minutes, same older man in a polo shirt came out and sat 2 women next to us.  With in 2 minutes a waitress came out to take their drink order.  Asked if they had any questions on menu, and then took their food order!  She looked at me (as she had to squeeze past to get by as we were closest to the sidewalk) and said "I'll be right with you".  After a few minutes she came back out and went to the first table of girls to take another drink order, looked at use and went back inside.  After 5 minutes, with not even a glass of water, and the table after us placing their drink and food order, I decided to poke my head in the door to see if they were just really slammed...they're not. There's maybe 8 people total inside.  i'm going to put my phone down for 10 min before I start writing this review incase they come out with an excuse for the lack of service, or just wont come over with my phone out.

Its now been 25+ minutes total.  No waitress, no drinks, no chance in hell I'm going to sit here like a fool and wait to be disappointed even more.  I don't care if they have kobe beef tacos with free tequila shots, I'm going next door where I know I can get good food and equally as good service.

I highly recommend avoiding this place.  There is a taco shop a few storefronts down to the right and one about 1.5 blocks in the other direction with a liquor license, both with excellent service and food.  Go there, avoid the same disappointment we had.

Bland. Overpriced. Came with NOTHING on the side. 

We had to order chips & salsa for a 'side' and the salsa is just off-brand Tostitos. Chips are very oily. Very unappetizing.

This $28 (2 burritos, some chips and a cup of salsa) meal didn't even come with a garnish or sour cream or complementary salsa/sauce. 

What a disappointment. I wish I could get my money back, but I'm exhausted and just want to relax at home instead of returning this stuff.

Went here with the hubster and some friends for a friends birthday party.  When we first arrived, we'd wondered where we were going to sit, because we'd made a reservation for 8 people, and there were no available tables.  The waitress immediately went back to where our table was to be, and told the people who had sat themselves, that they had to move, due to the table being reserved.  Most places don't even do that anymore, afraid to "butt hurt" a customer. So for that I give kudos. Brave waitresses = Ok by me :)
I ordered the espresso martini (can't remember the exact name but I know it had espresso in it, and I had two of them) Muey Bueno! I ordered enchiladas and oh my goodness it was almost too much food for me .  I moved here from Oregon over a year ago, and had been trying to find a tex-mex/mexican place worth a crap, and now I've found something to tie me over until  my next mexican/tex-mex adventure at least, and I know if In Manayunk, Cactus is where I'm at for some grubbin food, and some stellar martinis!

Went here for Sunday brunch by myself. I was pretty exhausted from the night before since I was alone in my new apartment up a few blocks for the first weekend night and binge-watched CSI: Miami on Netflix. I used to watch this show a lot with Cynthia (my ex-wife) but she was always more of a CSI: NY fan. 

I know that's not what caused us to split, something so trivial. But it just became a thing where I'd come home from the office (I'm an actuary). I mean, I love my line of work. Risk valuation is a constant challenge. And I just got some new responsibilities training kids just out of college starting out as actuaries. But I let the stress get to me, I guess. But we have some deadlines we have to meet for our client before they can start constructing that parking garage in Conshohocken and the risk modelling can get a bit difficult. 

I really needed to learn to not take my job home with me. I wish I had a better work/life balance. I mean, what's more important -- being there for Bradley and Bryan (our twin sons) for their dance recital or staying home to crunch Excel spreadsheets? I just really messed a lot of things up and I know that no but it's too late. 14-years of marriage gone. 

Anyways, the brunch at Cactus is TREMENDOUS. It's a simple little buffet -- nothing too fancy, but all of it so tasty! The western hash browns were cooked just right, scrambled egg bin was done to perfection and they even had some soft-shelled taquitos. I had a Bloody Mary and it was too spicy, but to be fair I made it myself at the Bloody Mary bar so it was my fault, like everything has been for 14 years.

Tony makes Cactus! Me and my close friend usually come to Cactus every week for their specials and to enjoy some of the sports that are being televised. We love the wings, chips and salsa, and the constant attention from are waiters and waitress. Tony always makes sure we are taken care of. Definitely our go to!

I sat at the bar and was given chips and salsa while I was waiting for the food to come. The salsa wasn't chunky and had a nice kick to it

The food did take a while to come but the chips kept me busy. I ordered their 35 cent wings and the fish tacos.

Wings were pretty decent. They were crispy and also had a mild kick.

Fish tacos had fried fish and purple cabbage coleslaw. It also came with a side of rice. There was a nice amount of fish in the tacos and it was seasoned perfectly. The only issue was the dryness. I asked for a sauce for the tacos and they gave me the chipotle mayo which complimented the tacos very well.

The bartender was very attentive and outgoing. The drinks weren't strong tho. It was quizzo night which was free to participate. The host was really funny and offered shots to ppl who were winning each round

This is the worst experience I have ever had with a restaurant/lounge. I was visiting Philadelphia from DC with my friend from overseas, and the bartender/host was really rude. He pretended he couldnt serve us without US ids. Should we declare Philadelphia a no foreigner zone? This was racism at its best! Do not support this kind of business. Thanks!

Used to come for years when I lived in the city. We came every week for the wing special and drinks. I miss going there. I will be regrouping with the guys this week and anticipate the good food and hope to see some familiar faces when we get there. Wings are cheap, tasty and big. Drinks are always good, reasonably priced and come quick from the bar.

After moving to Manayunk from center city Philadelphia me and my friends were hoping to find a place that could satisfy our cravings for south of the boarder cuisine as well as places like El Vez and El Rey. After trying the Cactus in Manayunk I believe we found a place that could easily be considered the equal of places such as that. They started us off with an order of chips and salsa as good as any I've had, and we ordered a corona tower that held about 8 beers for only $25(great deal). For an appetizer we ordered the Santa Fe Eggrolls and "Fire Cracker" jalapeño poppers. Both were delectable, and while I'm usually skeptical about ordering poppers because you never seem to get enough for the price, they were at least 3X the size of what you would normally expect and easily enough for the four of us. I ordered steak fajitas for my entree and they were very satisfying for the price. Overall the service was great and it was an overall pleasant experience. They have outdoor seating right on Main Street and we will definitely be back Sunday for their all you can eat brunch buffet and $2.50 mimosas and bloody Mary's.

I posted a 5 star review for cactus 7 years ago and after all this time I am still just as impressed. The food is consistently good and the staff are extremely friendly. Definitely would recommend this place to friends, family, or even strangers.

I honestly never leave reviews for restaurants but this was so terrible I felt I had to share. My boyfriend and I came on a Thursday night and ordered a pitcher of margaritas and we both got the chicken tacos. The pitcher of classic margs was actually an overflowing pitcher filled with ice and a splash of margarita mix from the grocery store and maybe one shot of tequila in the whole pitcher. They were the worst margs I've ever tasted. The chicken in the tacos was literally rubber and my boyfriends tacos came out with the toppings he asked them to leave off. He would have sent them back but no one checked on us or asked how everything was.  Do not waste your time or money at this awful "mexican" place. Go to taqueria Feliz or la roca if you're on Main Street.

We have been to the Bayou (same owner, nice guy named Tony) many times before and always enjoyed it. Today we decided to try out Cactus, and were not disappointed. Started with some complimentary chips and salsa, had a delicious margarita, and got burritos (I got veggie and my boyfriend got steak). Quality food for a reasonable price, and they play a lot of fun throwback songs I haven't heard in years. Will definitely be back!
I love this place! This is my normal happy hour spot.  They always have good food and drink specials. The staff is always nice and fun, which is always a plus

This is one of my favorite spots to cone to on Main St. The manager Tony is always so nice to me and my friends and the service is always on point. The bartenders are just amazing (Collieen is thee best)...  I recommend this place to anyone in the area... Seriously!!!!

Ordered some takeout from here in Cinco De Mayo and was horribly disappointed. Pictured is $100 worth of food. The food was sparse which bothered me the most. The Chicken Fajitas had literally 4 cubes of chicken and the $10 side of guac was a small quarter sized container. The food was fine nothing special but the lack of substance for the prices was disappointing. The burrito was really good though!
Taco Tuesdays and Wing Wednesdays!! What more do you need!? Also their margaritas are amazing

Had drinks and apps with coworkers last night and everything was amazing. I love coming to Cactus every time I hit Main Street. Tony and his staff are amazing and always accommodating to me and my friends. I highly recommend giving Cactus a try you won't be disappointed!! Thanks Tony!!!

I will definitely be coming back here.  My roommate and I were looking for somewhere to go have a drink after work and using Yelp I stumbled across Cactus.  Both of us ended up having the Pasion de Fresca (strawberry) margaritas and they were amazing.  We both agreed we would make this the first stop on a weekend night before heading out.  We got the small plate of classic nachos and they were the perfect amount for the two of us to share and the free chips and salsa were great.  Some other reviewers mentioned that theirs had been stale, but that certainly wasn't the case for us and we loved the guacamole.  It's a little small inside (at least on the first floor) and we were seated at a table by the door, so it did get chilly once more people started coming in and out, but I wouldn't count that against the place.  I absolutely recommend it.

I was in Manayunk for a charity bar crawl a couple of weeks ago, and we stopped at Cactus for some nachos. Like most bars in the area, a bouncer was checking IDs at the door. I felt like I was fresh out of college.  We grabbed a round of drinks which were moderately priced and ordered Cactus nachos. There was some kind of creamy corn sauce on the chips. The first couple of bites tasted great but my stomach felt like lead after 3 chips. These nachos are loaded and the "small" portion is huge. It also looked like there was an entire pint of sour cream dumped on top of the nachos. Four friends couldn't finish half of the dish.

Cactus nachos weren't bad, but I'd never make the trek out to Manayunk just to eat there. I'm spoiled with Loco Pez, Dos Segundos, and Sancho Pistola's all within walking distance.

I ABSOLUTELY fell in love with this place. I finally found a great mexican restaurant on Main Street!  It was a great atmosphere to relax and have a couple of drinks while eating some delicious food.  

I had the Strawberry Margarita which was delicious and the chicken quesadillas that were so filling!  

The wait staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Our server gave us the remote to change the channel for the TV in front of us which was so nice.  

I definately recommend coming here and trying the place out! I took a look at their weekly specials, and they look great!  I know that I will be back!

Stopped here for lunch on a leisurely stroll through my old neighborhood.  This place ranks in the middle of the pack: not the best, nor the worst bar on Main Street.  The pulled pork sandwich was juicy and tangy, surprisingly it even tasted good the next day ( I took the leftovers home). The real stars of the meal were the salsa and chips.....the chips were salted and cooked to crispy perfection,  the salsa was fresh and flavorful-yum yum!

Unfortunately, the bar tender was also the only server during the lunch rush.  He was great at juggling both stations and even had time to throw in a few jokes but you could tell he was overwhelmed.  I definitely want to come back to this place and give it another whirl.

Great place, good atmosphere!  Colleen by far is the best bar tender around!  She is friendly and sweet and takes the time to make sure her customers are served right!  Every time we come we make sure she is here, great to see her smile!  Good food and excellent service!
The only good thing was our sweet waitress . Disgusting nachos with some fake queso . How the heck do you mess up nachos ? Margarita was gross too . Yuck yuck yuck.

This is a good spot if you're looking for a decent priced margarita. $7-10. They also do pitchers from $20-$30.  The food isn't special, nothing unique or very flavorful.  Big portions. It is what you would expect.  They have outside seating when it's nice out.  Service was very slow - no one came to the table for 15 minutes and the server was awkward.
Went for a Margarita tasting/birthday celebration and had a fabulous time! Food was delicious and Tony was the best bartender:). Will definitely come back!

Let me preface this that the if I could give 5 stars for the wings and salsa..I would. 

Cactus is usually my go-to for cheap wings on Thursday's, but lately I've become more and more disappointed and it stems from the absolutely poor service.

1. Do not order a soda unless you ask beforehand if there are free refills. I found this out the hard way because despite not being charged for refills on the various occasions (10+ times I've been there) I was charged. I asked the waitress about this and she said "it depends on who is working as to who charges you"... which is my opinion is ridiculous. Also- I can't even remember the last time I was ever charged for a refill at any restaurant I've been to.

2. The drinks are very watered down. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas with my friends and it was 10% alcohol / 90% juice. I wouldn't waste your money on those.

3. The manager is very rude almost every time I'm there. 

4. The service is slow and almost non existent. (This is not all of the time.. There have been times my waitresses has been awesome) In particular, last night our waitress took 20 minutes to bring us our drinks and chips and salsa. She never asked us for refills on anything. In addition, she also forgot to bring my friend her food.. I can't imagine tacos take an hour to make. 

It's unfortunate because sometimes I go to cactus and everything is great, but lately I've been walking out disappointed. I will likely go back intermittently because you can't beat 10 wings for 3.50, but I would never go there for any other food. If you want good Mexican, you should walk down to La Taqueria Feliz.. much better food and service.
I come here after my weekday softball games. Love the wings and chips/salsa! Tony and his staff are always pleasant and welcoming. Definitely recommend!

Cactus is the only restaurant I've been to where I've had to stop eating the food because it was so terrible. I gagged several times while trying to eat their beef "enchiladas". It was just a plate of greasy ground beef and a big heap of burnt cheese. It didn't even come with enchilada sauce to help drown out the disgusting mess of whatever it was on my plate.

I had their nachos previously which are actually pretty good, but holy crap were their enchiladas impossible to eat without gagging. 

The margaritas came with flies in the mix, too.

I won't go there again for sure.
Amazing service, amazing tacos, amazing drinks. If you want a nice afternoon with Mexican flavor, this is the spot to go to.

I'm reposting this because yelp hid it away in the "not recommended" section. Screw you yelp, I will not be censored.

My girlfriend and I go here on a near biweekly basis, thats not an exaggeration. The food isn't out of this world or anything but its always delicious and they've got the best margaritas anywhere (if you like them sweet). The brownie dessert which they just added a few months ago is one of my favorite desserts of all time. Recommend the quesadilla and the cactus nachos (with corn), so f-ing good.

My girlfriend and I stopped here by chance on a Saturday around 4 pm. There were only a couple at the bar and a couple at a table so we made the third couple. The only employee visible was the bartender who let us seat ourselves but quickly approached us with chips and salsa.  She was pleasant and helpful throughout our service. She was very attentive considering she had to wait on 3 tables, make the drinks, and run up and down stairs to retrieve the food.  Her service was 5 stars.

We ordered a pitcher of Sangria, chicken enchiladas and a loaded 5-alarm burrito.  Sangria was definitely premixed, but delicious. It had plenty of alcohol for my liking.  My girlfriend's enchiladas were flavorful and chicken was moist. My burrito was well seasoned throughout and very fresh. In my opinion,  the enchilada sauce is not authentic, but it didn't detract too much from the rest of the meal.  Food was 4 stars.

The decor and feel of the place is very much main street Manayunk.  Clean and modern eatery during the day, but obvious night life place for social drinks.  Simple wall decor with multiple chalkboards displaying the drink specials caters more to the drinking crowd. Decor was 4 stars.

Overall we were pleased with this experience and would recommend it to others.  I'm disappointed that previous reviews say poor things about the Margaritas, but we did avoid them for that reason. Perhaps we will try them ourselves on a future visit.
Tony is AMAZING! Drinks and chips were great, and service was phenomenal. Will definitely be back!
Very slow service on online orders I always wait for them. I believe thats something they dont care at all.

The worst service I've gotten here. I've been here a couple of times and the drinks are not good at all your better off ordering beers. But this time around it took forever to get our food and the service was horrible the waiter even threw my friends change on the table after he said he needed the change back. Meaning he was expecting to get tipped even after treating us like an after thought. Wish I could do 0 stars, never going back again. And to make it worst it was 5 de Mayo, thanks for ruining that for us.
Great atmosphere with good prices. Wing night is awesome. One of the few staples in Manayunk.

My boyfriend and I were dining in for the cheap wings. We asked our server for another order to go and if it was the same price. She said no. So we asked what if we got them for dining in but then boxed them to go...she said yes?? Lmao, I was surprised that worked? Lol... anyways the manager came over as expected and apologized because our server was wrong but he would still honor the discounted price for half the order.
best service/drinks in manayunk! eric my bartender was efficient and knew how to make the perfect drinks. will definitely return!

Out of all of the Mexican restaurants in Manayunk, Cactus is by far the best. Not only does it have the friendliest service, but also the most delicious food. The chips are fresh and the salsa has a great, smoky flavor. If I don't get the steak quesadilla, I usually will split an appetizer and the chicken fajitas for two with my wife. That's after a pitcher of margaritas with salt. Don't miss out on the happy hour deals or Saturday brunch!

Had planned on going to another Manayunk restaurant but parking was so bad I had to park all the way on the other side of Main Street so my mom and I decided to just go to Cactus because it was close.  It was not my first time at Cactus and I didn't remember loving it but wanted to give it another chance.  We ordered from the very limited menu some nachos and some tacos to share.  I felt prices were way too high for the volume of food we got.  Our order took FOREVER and everyone around us seemed to get their food way ahead of us.  We saw a waiter carry our food and then he was staring at it really closely.  He showed another waiter and then headed back downstairs.  This was concerning.  When the nachos finally arrived they seemed much smaller than expected, as though someone had scraped off all the side nachos.  We got vegetarian nachos and yet there was chicken sprinkled all throughout.  Obviously they had realized that we didn't order the chicken and tried just scraping it off and hoping we wouldn't notice.  Fortunately I eat meat so it was okay, but what if I had been really allergic to chicken or a vegetarian?

The food was okay but not great and given the prices I really don't see any need to go back to Cactus again.  It's just not that great.

Food here is delicious. After my second visit they knew who I was already. Staff makes you feel like family, always joking around and poking fun, equates to a good time every time. Kyle has to be my favorite bartender in manayunk hands down. Tony is a phenomenal owner and manager of both bayou and cactus. Highly recommend

This is a fun place for a casual meal or drink... The specials are excellent,, especially the 10 dollar margartia Mondays and 25 cent chicken wing Wednesdays.. The waitresses are young and cute and always helpful.. The food is consistent and I recommend the quesadillas, burritos and sandwiches... If you are a craft beer fan, the selection on both draft and bottles is excellent.. The games are on the TVs also so if you like to watch the game along with your meal and drink its a good place for that... Its a young crowd here too so be prepared for that...

I'm a big fan of free chips and dips and whatnot, however, I am not a fan of stale chips and flavorless dip and this happens to be what I got at Cactus. 

I enjoyed the decor but the food wasn't really anything special or out of the ordinary, especially with the prices they charge. They have taco Tuesdays where tacos are 2 bucks each...Let's just say I'd refer you to taco bell before telling you to come here for tacos.

In any case, also on Tuesdays, they have their "Cactus Margarita" for 5 bucks. I'm not gonna say it's a great deal because it tastes like something straight outta the mix bottle, therefore, something I could've made for myself and a bunch of friends for much less than $5 per head.

I've eaten at the Cactus twice- the first time wasn't a great time and I swung back for a 2nd round just in case I could prove myself wrong but alas, I've come to the conclusion that I won't be making a 3rd trip here.

Been wanting to try Cactus since I read about it in the Inquirer. Not impressed.

The chips were below average (mass produced, not home made)...and very stale! The salsa tasted like pureed tomatoes with specks of cilantro...it was awful...no flavor! If you're going to be a southwest/mexican themed restaurant, it's essential to have respectable chips and salsa.

The so-called spicy caesar salad was average (and not spicy)...it could have been worse, but also could have been much better. The chicken tacos were ok, but not much flavor or creativity.

The Lobster Quesadillas were ok, but again, could be better.

The limes in our drinks were old, discolored, and dried out. I requested some extras and they were more of the same.

The service was spotty, with very young, unexperienced, and poorly trained servers.

Mens bathroom was exceptionally clean.

Bottom line - there are so many better southwest and authentic mexican restaurants in the philly area. I won't be going back to this one.

It was a bustling Thursday night and we were wandering Manayunk for a good 30 min before we settled on Cactus Restaurant. It was one of the places that had seating available last minute for 6 and their billboard of 50 different margarita flavors and pitchers, and $5 quesadillas enticed us in.

Oh the regrets. Make a reservation and go elsewhere.  

We got their mango jalapeño margarita pitcher, green apple margarita pitcher $5 chicken quesadilla, queso dip, and seasoned fries (can't remember the name and it's not on their online menu for some reason).  
- Margaritas: The flavors were not bad; don't let the jalapeno deter you - it's not that spicy... but I could not taste ANY alcohol and there was SO MUCH ICE. Not really worth it. 
- Chicken quesadillas: This  was dry and flavorless with minimal cheese and chicken. No amount of their salsa or sour cream could salvage it. The hot sauce helped.
- Queso dip was ordered by a friend and I didn't try - but they left 75% of it behind.
- Seasoned fries: These were NOT seasoned. The best part of this was the cooked jalapeno and onions on it. Might as well have gotten regular fries. 

All in all. I'm not coming back here. There are so many better choices in Manayunk.
Had the best time tonight all because of Colleen! My absolute favorite bartender in manayunk. Great drinks and super fun vibe. Thanks Colleen!

I'm sorta shocked that this place doesnt have better reviews, Im always happy with my order and the staff has always been ok. And the chips are pretty good, although only one basket is free, waitress forgot to mention if u ask for a refill they charge each time.

A solidly three star restaurant. We stopped by for lunch during the Manayunk Arts Festival to rest our legs and enjoy the air conditioning. The wait staff was very friendly and efficient dashing from table to table helping customers. We were expecting a Mexican restaurant, but this place is more of a tex mex establishment with typical bar decor. They serve "Americanized" Mexican meals like burritos and tacos that didn't have any exotic ingredients. The plates were plastic (picnic type) which was odd, but maybe it was just due to the arts festival. The food was ok. I had the breakfast burrito which was good, but not spectacular.  It came with a side of tortilla chips, but no salsa was offered.

Went for $0.25 Wednesday wing night,  they only have one flavor of wings... a mild buffalo. Cannot get a to go box if you dont make an additional food purchase or drink. Their complimentary chips and salsa were really good. Service was speedy and friendly. Will definitely try again, they have lots of specials!

No utensils. Dirty bathroom. Cafeteria food. Pretty sure the bartender was high AF because he was so confused and there was hardly anyone there. I felt bad for him though, so I still tipped him well. Kinda depressing.

Cactus has pretty good food. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly. They have really good weekday specials, too. Plus, they give you unlimited chips and salsa, which might be one of my favorite things about the place. 

Their margaritas can be kind of expensive. On Mondays, they do Margarita Monday, which means you get a pitcher (maybe 4 margaritas) for ten dollars. They're a little watered down, but it's still a pretty good deal. 

I'd recommend you check it out during happy hour for some good specials.

I don't usually complain on here, but I figured I should include some place I thought was awful, instead of just my 5-star places.  Cactus is a good place to drink (so I've been told) but unless you are stoned out of your mind, don't order food there.  We went for a cheap brunch with the kids and I had to choke my food down.  It was a total waste.  NOTHING was flavorful.  Everything was dried out and barely edible.  Sooo... good crowd and drinking bar - yes.  Restaurant, NO!!!!

The burritos are really good! I have gotten the shrimp burrito twice and it was great. If soda is your thing the sodas taste really strange maybe due to the water in the area so I would maybe steer clear of that. I have forgotten my ID both times but def trying a margarita next time, they have a great happy hour.

This was a great spot to go after being in the cold for so long for the Eagles Super Bowl parade. At the time there was one waitress on the floor but she was amazing (she even let me charge my phone, true angle). We were able to get street parking right in front if the restaurant and as a party of 4, was seated very quickly. In addition the staff was extremely polite. They had a special of $0.35 wings with a Smokey buffalo sauce. It was great and the price was even better for 10 wings. My only complaint was that a basket of unseason fries cause $7.00, that overpricing a item with no real value. A lot of specials start later so I would recommend this place for and evening time of spot unless you don't want a crowd its perfect  for the lunch hour as well.
Best nachos in town. Get the cactus nachos. Bartender Kyle is great. Recommend Taco Tuesday also.

Got take out from this place today. I am not one to complain about food - ever, but this was my worst dining experience. The portion was tiny, compared to the price. The presentation was almost Fyre Festival-like and the taste was on the verge of mediocrity.

I never give one star to any establishment lightly, but from the time we got there it was honestly the worst experience.

We walked in and immediately asked to be seated outside. The host accommodated us even though there was only a two seat table left. Our waitress took about fifteen minutes to even acknowledge us. It wasn't that busy. Just a regular Tuesday night. She was apologetic so we said it happens - no big deal. 

Well if didn't end there. We each ordered the classic margarita and I got two beef tacos. She took our orders and said she would be back with waters. A whole 25 minutes went by and she finally brought over the margaritas. I have to rant here - they were awful. Tasted like watered down sour mix. My friend finally reminded her that we never got waters. She apologized and went to get them for us. She brought back two glasses when there were three of us at the table. At this point we are all just confused at the service. 

Finally - the tacos arrive. They looked underwhelming but I was so hungry I took a bite right away. It tasted bland so I opened it to put hot sauce on it. At a closer look - I found a long hair that was buried in the sour cream. I waved the waitress down to tell her and she took them away immediately. I told her I no longer wanted food and she could tell I was upset. To make matters worse, no one came out to acknowledge what happened nor offered to comp our drinks for the horrendous experience we had. 

We all left incredibly disappointed and most likely will never return. Save your money - go somewhere else.

I wasn't the greatest fan of the food. The chips were ok but the salsa- I couldn't tell if it was actually salsa or some other random sauce. It was very smooth and sweet, which are terrible adjectives salsa at a Mexican place. My friend and I got the veggie [mushroom] burrito. It was ok. Not the worst, but definitely not the best. It had some flavors coming through from the mushroom, rice, and beans, but was lacking seasoning and a bit of salt. It was also a bit dry on the inside.
Came in with a group of 20+ and the staff was very accommodating. Our waiter, Kyle was awesome and so was the food! Will definitely be back.
This place was great, tonight was the guava margarita special and it was so delicious. I loved that they had out door seating!

Really a sports bar. 
Ordered chicken enchiladas which, including the black beans and rice were lukewarm. My friend's burrito was hot. I declined to have it warmed and ordered a chicken fajita salad which was fine.
Service rather lackadaisical.
No reason to go back.

Meh.  The food sucks, to be honest.  I mean, it's greasy and fatty -- which can be good, very good, even -- but it's just too poor quality to be worth eating again.  The taco shells look like the type you buy from the supermarket, they put too much cheese on their nachos (which, seriously, for me is basically impossible).  HOWEVER, they give you free chips and salsa, which is always a plus, the service is friendly, and they have cheap margs.  It's worth a shot for people on a budget or people who want to get marg-wasted.  But, if you care about the quality of your food, you should go to tacqueria feliz a few blocks down the street.

1 ounce of "guacamole" for $11. There was no flavor. Just mashed avocado. Insanity. I ordered via DoorDash and my order was royally screwed up in all facets. 

Not worth it. Next time I'll just not eat

I love this place! Every time I have been here the service was awesome. I usually go to Cactus to get a couple of drinks with friends, but I can never resist getting food there too. They have the best nachos on Main St. without a doubt. The fish tacos are also really good. Overall, I would say this place has everything you would expect from a great bar with the added bonus of delicious bar food and great service.

I went for breakfast with 7 people on Sunday.  We had a great time. Service was great and so was the Sangria....it tasted just right..!  Everyone enjoyed their b-fasts...everyone got omelets  or wraps.  I am looking forward to doing a dinner there.
I saw they are doing a Fajitas and Ritas on Monday night....$8.99 for fajitas and $5 for ritas.
1/2 price sangria on sundays!

I went in to Cactus with a group of friends for dinner last Saturday night. The food is really good considering how reasonably priced it is. There are a lot of placed in the Yunk in which you can pay twice as much and receive inferior food. They have the college football package which is really cool. We were watching three different games at once while we ate, and our waiter was a lot of fun to talk to...he knew a lot about both beer and football which made for good drinks and interesting discussion. 

We had originally planned to go to the brew pub after dinner but we ended up staying. They were running a ladies night special and there were A LOT of hot girls in there. We ended up closing the place down and having a blast. I'll definitely be there again soon.
If you asked your whitest friend to please make the least spicy food possible, then restricted him from using salt or pepper, this is what those tacos would taste like.

Very unprofessional establishment. I was a solo diner on a Tuesday night and was yelled at for asking for a table for one.. the guy 
  who worked there claimed he was working alone and couldn't help me for 20 mins. Furthermore the place reeked of trash and old sponges as soon as you walk in.. AVOID this dump. Gladly left and went to the place next door instead.

Small bar but great Mexican Food!  any the tacos are great!  I prefer the pork, but the usually get some of the beef and chicken too!  Fresh nachos are always great for dippin with the salsa they make in house.  I am a big fan of the Texas Shrimp and the firecrackers!

THe kitchen is open late so I like stopping by for a beer  and a late nite snack!

Really good draft beer selection - always something new!

My girl loves their tequila selection!

Liam makes the best Margaritas in town!

Great staff and always fun!

Pros-- if you are starving you can get fresh food
Cons- flour taco and burrito were dry and not flavorful and not spicy 
If you want Mexican go to Chipotle.

Having eaten at several Manayunk restaurants and bars, I totally get the varied reviews. Service and food quality in this neighborhood is often incredibly hit or miss. Fortunately for me, Cactus was totally a hit!

Granted, I hadn't eaten all day, and by six ish this girl was STARVING. Our original restaurant plan ended up being closed on Mondays (why do people do that?), and I remembered a friend telling me about the Monday specials at Cactus. Turned out to be 9 dollar fajitas, any style, and 10 dollar (!) house margarita pitchers. 

The margs ended up being delicious, and surprisingly strong and labor intensive for 10 dollars. We sat the bar; I like to do this in order to stare down my bartender to ensure maximum tequila pours. JK. Kind of. The whole menu looked delicious, if you know what you're getting yourself into. Guys, this is total Tex Mex; not authentic by any stretch. To save myself time and deliberation, we both just got the pulled pork fajitas after the bartender assured us anything with pulled pork was their specialty. And the meat was really good, guys. Tasty and tender. Nothing ground breaking about the fajitas, but everything tasted pretty fresh. Ingredients that were supposed to be cold were cold and ingredients that were supposed to be hot were hot. Service at the bar, even by a bartender in training, was excellent as well. BF and I stuffed ourselves and got a little tipsy (maybe mostly me) for under 40 bucks. steal in manayunk!

As with any other nearby location, go to Manayunk on OFF nights. Mondays & Tuesdays. Go early or late, depending on when the place is least crowded. Sitting at the bar generally ensures better service, bartenders in Manayunk have the slowest turnovers and are generally better than the waitstaff. Not the rule, just a suggestion.

I'm usually the first to suggest going to Cactus. Their food is generally solid and prices are reasonable. Unfortunately tonight was not what were used to when we came to pick up a takeout order. Servers and bartenders were pulling down masks while leaning in to talk to patrons and making drinks without masks on. 

Food was not nearly as good as usual. The fajitas were the smallest portion I've ever seen. The steak burrito was all fat. The wings were so overdone the bones were cracked and splintered.
